articles.title: The Download: the future of nuclear power plants, and social media-fueled AI hype

Why AI companies are betting on next-gen nuclear AI is driving unprecedented investment for massive data centers and an energy supply that can support
articles.content: This is today’s edition of The Download , our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Why AI companies are betting on next-gen nuclear AI is driving unprecedented investment for massive data centers and an energy supply that can support its huge computational appetite. One potential source of electricity for these facilities is next-generation nuclear power plants , which could be cheaper to construct and safer to operate than thei
articles.author: Rhiannon Williams

articles.title: What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built
articles.description: What languages are growing fastest, and why? What about the projects that people are interested in the most? Where are new developers cutting their teeth? Let’s take a look at Octoverse data to find out. The post What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built appeared first
articles.content: In 2025, software development crossed a quiet threshold. In our latest Octoverse report , we found that the fastest-growing languages, tools, and open source projects on GitHub are no longer about shipping more code. Instead, they’re about reducing friction in a world where AI is helping developers build more, faster. By looking at some of the areas of fastest growth over the past year, we can see how developers are adapting through: The programming languages that are growing most in AI-as
articles.author: Dylan Birtolo

articles.title: What happens if someone breaks the rules?
articles.description: Last weekend my good friend Jos van Schouten and I presented a session in the Community devroom at FOSDEM. Between the two of us we've run a lot of events. And we’ve learned this: when someone violates your Code of Conduct, what makes all the difference is whether the organizers are prepared to act.
articles.content: Last weekend my good friend Jos van Schouten and I presented a session in the Community devroom at FOSDEM. Between the two of us we've run a lot of events. And we’ve learned this: when someone violates your Code of Conduct, what makes all the difference is whether the organizers are prepared to act. Today almost every event has a Code of Conduct. We weren't going to cover what makes a good document, or why it's there, instead we wanted to talk about the moment nobody likes to plan for. We quickl
articles.author: Floor Drees

articles.title: Apple AirTag (2026) review: Simply  better
articles.description: It’s hard to tell the difference between Apple’s second-generation AirTag and the almost-five-year-old original just by looking at them. In fact, the only way to tell is the many scratches on my old tracker, picked up from all those years attached to my keyring, living in my pocket. While the price
articles.content: It’s hard to tell the difference between Apple’s second-generation AirTag and the almost-five-year-old original just by looking at them. In fact, the only way to tell is the many scratches on my old tracker, picked up from all those years attached to my keyring, living in my pocket. While the price is still $29, Apple’s latest tracker packs some core upgrades. The new AirTag has a second-generation ultra-wideband (UWB) chip that extends its Precise Finding range up to 50 percent, though it requi
articles.author: Mat Smith

articles.title: Anthropic says ‘Claude will remain ad-free,’ unlike ChatGPT
articles.description: Anthropic has announced that it won't be bringing ads to its AI chatbot Claude, in sharp contrast to confirmed plans from OpenAI to allow advertising in ChatGPT. To hammer the point home further, the company is releasing a Super Bowl commercial that makes fun of unnamed rivals adding adverts to thei
articles.content: Claude plans to run one ad before the Super Bowl, and another during it. | Screenshot: Claude ad Anthropic has announced that it won't be bringing ads to its AI chatbot Claude, in sharp contrast to confirmed plans from OpenAI to allow advertising in ChatGPT. To hammer the point home further, the company is releasing a Super Bowl commercial that makes fun of unnamed rivals adding adverts to their AI. "We want Claude to act unambiguously in our users' interests," the company says in a new blog pos
articles.author: Dominic Preston

articles.title: Netflix says users can cancel service if HBO Max merger makes it too expensive
articles.description: 80 percent of HBO Max subscribers subscribe to Netflix, Sarandos tells Senate.
articles.content: There is concern that subscribers might be negatively affected if Netflix acquires Warner Bros. Discovery’s (WBD's) streaming and movie studios businesses. One of the biggest fears is that the merger would lead to higher prices due to Netflix having less competition. During a Senate hearing today, Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos suggested that the merger would have an opposite effect. Sarandos was speaking at a hearing held by the US Senate Judiciary Committee’s Subcommittee on Antitrust, Competitio
articles.author: Scharon Harding

articles.content: This is today’s edition of The Download , our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Microbes could extract the metal needed for cleantech In a pine forest on Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, the only active nickel mine in the US is nearing the end of its life. At a time when carmakers want the metal for electric-vehicle batteries, nickel concentration at Eagle Mine is falling and could soon drop too low to warrant digging. Demand for
articles.author: Rhiannon Williams

articles.title: Nintendo's first Direct showcase of 2026 is scheduled for February 5
articles.description: Nintendo has lined up its first showcase of the year. The next Nintendo Direct is taking place on February 5 at 9AM ET, the company has announced . It will run for around 30 minutes. As previous reports suggested, it will focus on third-party titles from partners instead of first-party games from Ni
articles.content: Nintendo has lined up its first showcase of the year. The next Nintendo Direct is taking place on February 5 at 9AM ET, the company has announced . It will run for around 30 minutes. As previous reports suggested, it will focus on third-party titles from partners instead of first-party games from Nintendo itself. So if you were hoping for new Mario or Zelda announcements, that may not happen during this event. Still, you can expect to hear about new games that are coming to Switch and Switch 2.
articles.author: Mariella Moon,Kris Holt

articles.title: Nvidia's $100 billion OpenAI deal has seemingly vanished
articles.description: Two AI giants shake market confidence after investment fails to materialize.
articles.content: In September 2025, Nvidia and OpenAI announced a letter of intent for Nvidia to invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI's AI infrastructure. At the time, the companies said they expected to finalize details "in the coming weeks." Five months later, no deal has closed, Nvidia's CEO now says the $100 billion figure was "never a commitment," and Reuters reports that OpenAI has been quietly seeking alternatives to Nvidia chips since last year. Reuters also wrote that OpenAI is unsatisfied with the speed
articles.author: Benj Edwards

articles.title: From guardrails to governance: A CEO’s guide for securing agentic systems
articles.description: The previous article in this series, “Rules fail at the prompt, succeed at the boundary,” focused on the first AI-orchestrated espionage campaign and the failure of prompt-level control. This article is the prescription. The question every CEO is now getting from their board is some version of: What
articles.content: The previous article in this series, “ Rules fail at the prompt, succeed at the boundary ,” focused on the first AI-orchestrated espionage campaign and the failure of prompt-level control. This article is the prescription. The question every CEO is now getting from their board is some version of: What do we do about agent risk? Across recent AI security guidance from standards bodies, regulators, and major providers, a simple idea keeps repeating: treat agents like powerful, semi-autonomous user
articles.author: Jessica Hammond

articles.title: How to maximize GitHub Copilot’s agentic capabilities
articles.description: A senior engineer's guide to architecting and extending Copilot's real-world applications. The post How to maximize GitHub Copilot’s agentic capabilities appeared first on The GitHub Blog .
articles.content: Modern engineering work rarely lives in a single file. Real systems evolve across years of incrementally layered decisions—some good, some accidental. A single feature request (“Add tagging to notes,” “Refactor the validation layer,” “Support a new consumer on our API”) often touches controllers, domain models, repositories, migrations, tests, documentation, and deployment strategy. Copilot’s agentic capabilities don’t replace your judgment i
articles.author: Ari LiVigni

articles.content: Amazon has announced that its generative AI-powered digital assistant Alexa Plus is now available to all Prime members in the US via any Alexa-enabled device, Alexa.com, and the Alexa mobile app. If you don't have Prime, you can access the assistant on a new free tier on the web and app, or pay $20 a month for unlimited access to Alexa Plus, without Prime. Alexa Plus initially launched in March 2025 in an Early Access program and, over the last year, has slowly expanded to tens of millions of us
articles.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy

articles.title: Apple's iPhone Air MagSafe battery is cheaper than ever
articles.description: Despite its supremely sleek design, the iPhone Air actually has a pretty respectable battery life, lasting for somewhere in the region of 27 hours if you’re continuously streaming video. But you’re still going to be wary of it dying on you if you’re on a trip or just having a particularly screen-hea
articles.content: Despite its supremely sleek design, the iPhone Air actually has a pretty respectable battery life, lasting for somewhere in the region of 27 hours if you’re continuously streaming video. But you’re still going to be wary of it dying on you if you’re on a trip or just having a particularly screen-heavy day. That’s where Apple’s iPhone Air MagSafe battery pack comes in, and it’s currently on sale for $79. This accessory only works with the iPhone Air, but much like the phone it attaches to, it’s e
articles.author: Matt Tate

articles.title: Understanding Concurrency Through Everyday Life Examples
articles.description: Concurrency is one of those concepts almost every developer uses — but many struggle to explain clearly. Most explanations jump straight into CPU cores, threads, and abstract diagrams. That’s usually where confusion starts. The irony? You already understand concurrency from real life. You’ve been do
articles.content: Concurrency is one of those concepts almost every developer uses — but many struggle to explain clearly. Most explanations jump straight into CPU cores, threads, and abstract diagrams. That’s usually where confusion starts. The irony? You already understand concurrency from real life. You’ve been doing it long before you wrote your first line of code. Let’s connect the dots. Why Concurrency Feels Hard to Understand When developers hear concurrency, they often think: “Multiple things running at t
articles.author: Dayo Jaiye

articles.content: On Wednesday, Spotify announced a few new lyrics features aiming to make it easier to understand and access song lyrics, including translations, previews, and offline lyrics. Lyric translations were originally introduced in 2022, but have only been available in specific markets so far. Now, they're rolling out worldwide to both free and premium Spotify users, who will soon start seeing a translation icon in the lyrics section on the app. When you tap this, "translations will appear based on your

articles.description: "This Titan is like a god, and the sea creatures worship it."
articles.content: Last month, Apple TV released a teaser for the second season of Monarch: Legacy of Monsters , part of Legendary Entertainment’s MonsterVerse , which brought Godzilla, King Kong, and various other monsters ( kaiju ) created by Toho Co., Ltd into a shared narrative. But we only got the most fleeting glimpse of the promised new mythical Titan threatening the human race. The full trailer just dropped and rectifies that: it's a gigantic tentacled undersea being dubbed Titan X—and only Kong and Godzil
articles.author: Jennifer Ouellette

articles.title: So yeah, I vibe-coded a log colorizer—and I feel good about it
articles.description: Some semi-unhinged musings on where LLMs fit into my life—and how I'll keep using them.
articles.content: I can't code. I know, I know—these days, that sounds like an excuse. Anyone can code, right?! Grab some tutorials, maybe an O'Reilly book, download an example project, and jump in. It's just a matter of learning how to break your project into small steps that you can make the computer do, then memorizing a bit of syntax. Nothing about that is hard! Perhaps you can sense my sarcasm (and sympathize with my lack of time to learn one more technical skill). Read full article Comments
articles.author: Lee Hutchinson

articles.title: Everyone is stealing TV
articles.description: Walk the rows of the farmers market in a small, nondescript Texas town about an hour away from Austin, and you might stumble across something unexpected: In between booths selling fresh, local pickles and pies, there's a table piled high with generic-looking streaming boxes, promising free access to
articles.content: Walk the rows of the farmers market in a small, nondescript Texas town about an hour away from Austin, and you might stumble across something unexpected: In between booths selling fresh, local pickles and pies, there's a table piled high with generic-looking streaming boxes, promising free access to NFL games, UFC fights, and any cable TV network you can think of. It's called the SuperBox, and it's being demoed by Jason, who also has homemade banana bread, okra, and canned goods for sale. "Peopl
articles.author: Janko Roettgers

articles.content: If you need a little help with your New Year's resolution to be more active, you can save on the latest Apple Watch right now. The Apple Watch Series 11 is on sale for $299, which is $100 off and the lowest price we've seen. We named the Apple Watch Series 11 as our choice for best smartwatch overall . It scored a 90 in our review thanks to its 24 hours-plus of battery life and a thin, light design that's easy to wear. It also offers new health metrics, including Apple's hypertension alerts syst

articles.content: SmartAlert(Title, Message) { global intellij_id WinGetPos, iX, iY, iW, iH, ahk_id %intellij_id% ; 1.
